subject: Business
title: Cialdini's Six Principles of Persuasion
description: One-minute skill: Cialdini's Six Principles of Persuasion.

hook.text: Robert Cialdini went undercover as a car salesman, fundraiser, and cult recruit to study persuasion.

buildup.text: He found six principles: reciprocity, scarcity, authority, consistency, liking, and social proof.

discovery.text: Every successful ad, pitch, or campaign uses at least one. Most use several simultaneously.

twist.text: These principles work because they're mental shortcuts â€” heuristics our brains use to decide quickly.

climax.text: Understanding these six forces lets you spot them in every marketing message you encounter.

punchline.text: Persuasion isn't magic. It's six levers pulled at the right time.

quiz.question: How many principles of persuasion did Cialdini identify?
